value.title: AI ethics backed by Pope and tech giants in new plan
value.excerpt: The Roman Catholic Church has joined up with IBM and Microsoft to work on the ethics of artificial intelligence. Leaders from the two tech giants met senior church officials in Rome, and agreed to collaborate on "human-centred" ways of designing AI. Microsoft president Brad Smith admitted some people may "think of us as strange bedfellows" at ...

value.title: The Catholic Church proposes AI regulations that ‘protect people’
value.excerpt: The “Rome Call for AI Ethics” lays out six broad principles: transparency, inclusion, responsibility, impartiality, reliability, and security and privacy. These principles say that technology should “protect people,” particularly the “weak and underprivileged.” They also urge policymakers across the world to create new forms of ...

value.title: Pontifical Academy for Life, tech companies, call for ethical use of AI technology
value.excerpt: “Algor-ethics,” according to the text, is the ethical use of artificial intelligence according to the principles of transparency, inclusion, responsibility, impartiality, reliability, security, and privacy. value.title: The Pope is getting on the AI bandwagon
value.excerpt: The tech giants signed the Vatican's “Rome Call for AI Ethics” pledge which asserts that technology should respect privacy, work reliably and do so without bias. It also says that AI technology should consider “the needs of all human beings” and operate transparently. The document reflects growing concerns among businesses and ...

value.excerpt: The German industrial firm, known for home appliances, power tools, automotive parts and more, is training 20,000 employees, roughly 5% of its global workforce, in the use of AI. The education program will include an AI code of ethics, which the company published on Feb. 19.
